company.mailing: NORTHSTAR UTILITIES | SUC#20421 | P.O. Box 1800 Denver, CO 80201

letter.intro: Thank you for being a valued Northstar Utilities customer. Please take a moment to review the enclosed contract documents, which reflect the recent changes you requested in your account. These include Your Rights as a Customer, Terms of Service, and Electricity Facts Label.
letter.body2: Thank you for choosing us to power your home. If you have any questions, we are here to help. You can reach us at 1-877-555-0184, Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. CST, and Saturday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. CST.

legal.title: TERMS OF SERVICE
legal.leftBlock:
TERMS OF SERVICE
Residential and Small Commercial
Northstar Utilities Services LLC d/b/a Northstar Utilities
P.O. Box 1800, Denver, Colorado 80201-1800
SUC Certificate No. 20421 | www.NorthstarEnergy.com
support@northstarenergy.example | 1-877-555-0184
Mon - Fri: 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. CST (Residential)
Saturday: 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. CST (Residential)
Mon - Fri: 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. CST (Small Commercial)
Key Defined Terms.
legal.rightIntro:
Prepaid Disclosure Statement (PDS): a document associated with a prepaid plan that provides the Connection Balance, Disconnection Balance, and other details regarding the plan.
SUC: the State Utility Commission.
REP: Energy Service Provider.
Residential Customer: retail customers classified as residential by the applicable bundled utility tariff, unbundled transmission and distribution utility tariff, or in the absence of classification under a residential rate class.

termsText:
SECTION 1
Prepaid Disclosure Statement (PDS): a document associated with a prepaid plan that provides the Connection Balance, Disconnection Balance, and other details regarding the plan.

SUC: the State Utility Commission. REP: Energy Service Provider. Residential Customer: retail customers classified as residential by the applicable tariff and rules.

Rules: the SUC Substantive Rules applicable to Energy Service Providers and regional grid operator protocols. Customers should review notices, labels, and disclosures before enrollment changes.

Sanctioned Person: any person that is the subject or target of sanctions, or owned or controlled by a sanctioned person, as defined by applicable regulations.

Sanctioned Territory: any country or territory subject to comprehensive sanctions, including areas identified by relevant authorities from time to time.

Sanctions: economic, financial, or trade restrictions administered by the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the European Union, or other competent authority.

Connection Balance: the balance required to establish or reconnect prepaid service. Base Charge: a charge assessed during each billing cycle to each ESI ID.

Billing Cycle: the period between billings for a given account, which may be monthly or otherwise. AutoPay: a payment option authorizing account or card debits.

Contract: collectively, the Letter of Authorization, these Terms of Service, Electricity Facts Label, and Your Rights as a Customer document, if applicable.

This sample section intentionally contains long-form content so pagination can be tested across multiple pages with repeated headers, repeated footers, and two-column flow text.

Customers should retain all pages of this package for records. Contact support if account data appears incorrect, if service address changes, or if disputes require investigation.

If disclosures are updated, revised documents will be delivered in the next communication cycle. Continued service use may constitute acceptance where permitted by law.

Phone, web, and mailing channels are available for support. Business hours and emergency procedures are listed in account notifications and provider contact pages.

efl.intro: This Electricity Facts Label (EFL) provides standardized plan information for quick comparison. It includes average energy prices at different usage levels, recurring delivery charges, contract term details, and key rights disclosures under Texas retail electricity rules.

charges.category: Average Price per kWh at 500 kWh usage
Average Price per kWh at 1000 kWh usage
Average Price per kWh at 2000 kWh usage

efl.disclosures:
Contract Term: 12 months from service start date.

 Early Termination Fee may apply if service is cancelled before end of contract term.

 Price includes generation charges and excludes taxes and non-bypassable charges unless otherwise stated.

 Transmission and Distribution Utility (TDU) charges are passed through and may change during the contract.

 This is a fixed-rate product for the term shown, except for changes in law, pass-through fees, or authorized adjustments.

 You have the right to receive disclosures and terms in accordance with applicable Public Utility Commission rules.

 For additional information visit www.northstarenergy.example or call 1-877-555-0184.

 This sample EFL page is provided for template parity testing with enterprise communication layouts.
efl.leftDetails:
Contract Term: 12 months.

Early Termination Fee: $150.00 if cancelled before end of contract term.

Base Charge: $9.95 per billing cycle.

Average price examples shown at 500 / 1000 / 2000 kWh monthly usage.

Price excludes taxes and government fees unless specifically stated otherwise.

TDU passthrough charges are regulated and may change during the contract term.
efl.rightDetails:
Billing cycle is monthly unless otherwise noted in your agreement.

Late payment and disconnection fees may apply per tariff and applicable rules.

You may contact customer support for account disputes, billing explanations, or service transfer questions.

Your Rights as a Customer and Terms of Service are part of the contract package.

For full details visit www.northstarenergy.example/support or call 1-877-555-0184.
efl.pageNote: This EFL sample page is formatted to mirror enterprise utility communications. Values shown are representative for demonstration only.
efl.planLine: Northstar Energy - Fixed Rate Product: Secure - 24
efl.priceDetails:
This price disclosure is based on average usage patterns and includes the following components of the price:

Energy Charge: 12.1c/kWh
Pass-Through TDSP Distribution Charge: 5.1248c/kWh
Pass-Through TDSP Customer and Meter Charge: $4.23 per month

The Energy Charge is fixed for the contract term. All TDSP charges listed will be passed through at cost and
aggregated on your bill. Your average price for electric service will vary according to your monthly usage.

The average price per kWh does not include a JustGreen charge.

The price does not include state or local taxes, reimbursement for state gross receipts tax, or city-authorized
cost recovery fees not included in the total average price shown.

A Minimum Usage Fee of $4.99 will apply to billing cycles less than 400 kWh.
efl.otherTermsReference: See Terms of Service statement for a full listing of fees, deposit policy, and other terms.

disclosureRows.question: Do I have a termination fee or any fees associated with terminating service?
Can my price change during contract period?
disclosureRows.answer: Yes, for TDU/TDSP, regional grid operator, and regulatory pass-through charges.

disclosureRows.question: What other fees may be charged?
disclosureRows.answer: See Special Service Fees and JustGreen in Terms of Service.

disclosureRows.question: Is this a pre-pay or pay in advance product?
Does the REP purchase exceed distributed renewable generation?
Customer assistance and low-income discount options
disclosureRows.answer: Programs may be available; contact support for eligibility details.

disclosureRows.question: Billing rights and complaint resolution
disclosureRows.answer: Billing complaints may be escalated to the State Utility Commission.

disclosureRows.question: Service transfer and move-out provisions
disclosureRows.answer: Transfer and move-out terms are defined in your contract package.

efl.contactLeft:
Northstar Utilities Services LLC d/b/a Northstar Utilities
P.O. Box 1800, Denver, CO 80201
www.NorthstarEnergy.com | SUC License #20421
efl.contactRight:
support@northstarenergy.example
Monday - Friday: 8AM - 7PM CST, Saturday: 9AM - 6PM CST
Phone: 1-877-555-0184 | Fax: 1-877-555-0192
